intro: Hieracium subramosum f. pseudoplicatum, commonly known as the false-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often notched or lobed. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, flat clusters, typical of the genus Hieracium. This form is distinguished by its slightly modified leaf structure compared to the typical subspecies, giving it a unique appearance.
